content:
I’m noticing just now that docs#CategoryTheory.Discrete.natIsoFunctor is tagged @[simp] in the source (this does not appear in the docs website, though). I thought that marking structures like (natural) Isomorphisms with simpis useless (as you don’t want to rewrite using those), and that things like this should rather be tagged @[simps].
Is there a particular reason for this one (and a bunch of others in this file) to be tagged this way (perhaps since under the hood in this case it’s an actual equality of functors?), or is this a mistake and I should make a PR putting simps instead?

It is probably a mistake. A tentative explanation is that a plain @[simps] would not work as we need to unfold some definitions in order to get appropriate simplification lemmas, in which case the solution is @[simps!].

Grepping around in the CategoryTheoryfolder, I found a few more instances that looked like this situation: #22223.

edit: removing the attribute on the mapBiprod isos seems to break a few things... It looks like it gets fixed by making it an abbrev, though.
